title: Paymentsense PED Information
text: Paymentsense PED Information Paymentsense is a fairly new terminal integration to MStore in which we only support the integration application on the till and not the terminal hardware, this is covered by Paymentsense. The Paymentsense application and logs can be found at the path below. "Paymentsense Helper" C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac If the PED is showing as offline/failing to connect when trying to process a card payment on the till, below is a few basic things to try before advising the customer to contact Paymentsense. Check the Paymentsense helper is running on the till Open Task manager and go to the 'Details' tab and look to see if the helper is running. The helper normally starts up with Merac POS so either restart POS or open it manually from the path mentioned above. Check the payment sense log file The log file is located in the path at the top of this page. You want to check the log for any obvious error messages. EXAMPLE OF AN ERROR MESSAGE IN THE LOG FILE from PS : 404 : {"userMessage":"'06354636' is unavailable. Please try again in 10 seconds or check the PDQ screen and cabling or restart the PDQ. Contact support if the problem persists."} 2022/07/13 09:05:34 : to PS : TID avail? : https://pv860c360000.connect.paymentsense.cloud/pac/terminals/06354636 : GET : Try rebooting the PED Power cycling the PED via disconnecting the main cable that runs out the back of the terminal. If you have tried all of the above checks and you believe the issue is not related to a fault within the integration application then advise the customer to contact paymentsense. Customer Not Present Information When prompting to take a card payment the below screen will show to continue to take a payment, or CNP, which is MAIL/PHONE ORDER Some tills won’t want to offer this option. The option can be disabled. The config file can be amended to have this added (In the same way as cashback was). True True = On False = Off If there is no setting present it will assume in (as it does with cash back). Below is a matrix of what the settings will do in combination. If you have Offercashbask=False and OfferCNP=False, no prompt appears, and a regular CP transaction starts straightaway. If Offercashback=True and OfferCNP=False, it prompts for Cashback Yes/No If Offercashback=True and OfferCNP=True, it prompts for either Cashback Yes/No or you can choose CNP If Offercashback=False and OfferCNP=True, it prompts for CP or CNP
description:
Paymentsense PED Information 

  

Paymentsense is a fairly new terminal integration to MStore in which we only support the integration application on the till and not the terminal hardware, this is covered by Paymentsense. 

  

The Paymentsense application and logs can be found at the path below. "Paymentsense Helper" 

C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac 

  

If the PED is showing as offline/failing to connect when trying to process a card payment on the till, below is a few basic things to try before advising the customer to contact Paymentsense. 

  

  1. Check the Paymentsense helper is running on the till 

  

Open Task manager and go to the 'Details' tab and look to see if the helper is running. The helper normally starts up with Merac POS so either restart POS or open it manually from the path mentioned above. 

  

 

  

  

  1. Check the payment sense log file 

  

The log file is located in the path at the top of this page. 

  

You want to check the log for any obvious error messages. 

  

 

  

EXAMPLE OF AN ERROR MESSAGE IN THE LOG FILE 

  

 from PS : 404 : {"userMessage":"'06354636' is unavailable. Please try again in 10 seconds or check the PDQ screen and cabling or restart the PDQ. Contact support if the problem persists."} 

2022/07/13 09:05:34  : to PS : TID avail? : https://pv860c360000.connect.paymentsense.cloud/pac/terminals/06354636 : GET :  

  

  1. Try rebooting the PED 

  

  • Power cycling the PED via disconnecting the main cable that runs out the back of the terminal. 

  

If you have tried all of the above checks and you believe the issue is not related to a fault within the integration application then advise the customer to contact paymentsense. 

  

Customer Not Present Information 

  

When prompting to take a card payment the below screen will show to continue to take a payment, or CNP, which is MAIL/PHONE ORDER 

  

 

  

  

Some tills won’t want to offer this option. The option can be disabled. The config file can be amended to have this added (In the same way as cashback was).  

  

<setting name="OfferCNP" serializeAs="String"> 

<value>True</value> 

</setting> 

  

True = On 

False = Off 

  

If there is no setting present it will assume in (as it does with cash back). Below is a matrix of what the settings will do in combination.  

  

If you have Offercashbask=False and OfferCNP=False, no prompt appears, and a regular CP transaction starts straightaway. 

If Offercashback=True and OfferCNP=False, it prompts for Cashback Yes/No 

If Offercashback=True and OfferCNP=True, it prompts for either Cashback Yes/No or you can choose CNP 

If Offercashback=False and OfferCNP=True, it prompts for CP or CNP

title: YesPay Invalid key Index
text: Here is a common error message that might appear on sites running the YesEFT interface for Worldpay. The error message is normally caused by corrupted files in the YesEFT directory on the till which will need to be replaced with new copies. Troubleshooting The logs for the terminal and YesPay interface can be found in the directory below. C:\YESEFT\logs There are two main log files that can be checked, which are TerminalInitializer.log and Yescps.log. You can also ask the customer about what is currently displayed on the terminal screen as there also might be helpful information displayed. Resolution First start by checking the following path - C:\YESEFT\Conf If the size of the file YESEFTTransactionLog.xml is bigger than 1KB then the file will need to be sent to Worldpay support via email (total.support@worldpay.com) as it may contain offline store transactions that need to be uploaded manually by World Pay. Further, if the size of the file YESEFTTransactionLog.xml is 1KB, then please follow the below steps and replace the common files to resolve the issue. 1. Copy all the files present at location C:\YESEFT\CommonFiles\conf and paste them at location C:\YESEFT\conf. If it will ask you to replace, replace the files. 2. Copy all the files present at location C:\YESEFT\CommonFiles\properties and paste them at location C:\YESEFT\properties. If it will ask you to replace, replace the files. 3. Open the file YESEFTConfig.bat and click Apply and then Ok. 4. Run the file StartPOSServer.bat to initialize the IPC. If the above does not resolve the issue then a key / data reset for the PED might be needed from World Pay which can be requested via email.
description:
Here is a common error message that might appear on sites running the YesEFT interface for Worldpay. The error message is normally caused by corrupted files in the YesEFT directory on the till which will need to be replaced with new copies. 

  

 

  

Troubleshooting 

  

The logs for the terminal and YesPay interface can be found in the directory below.  

  

C:\YESEFT\logs  

  

There are two main log files that can be checked, which are TerminalInitializer.log and Yescps.log. 

  

 

 

  

You can also ask the customer about what is currently displayed on the terminal screen as there also might be helpful information displayed. 

  

  

Resolution  

  

First start by checking the following path  - C:\YESEFT\Conf 

  

If the size of the file YESEFTTransactionLog.xml is bigger than 1KB then the file will need to be sent to Worldpay support via email (total.support@worldpay.com) as it may contain offline store transactions that need to be uploaded manually by World Pay. 

  

Further, if the size of the file YESEFTTransactionLog.xml is 1KB, then please follow the below steps and replace the common files to resolve the issue. 

  

1. Copy all the files present at location C:\YESEFT\CommonFiles\conf and paste them at location C:\YESEFT\conf. If it will ask you to replace, replace the files. 

  

2. Copy all the files present at location C:\YESEFT\CommonFiles\properties and paste them at location C:\YESEFT\properties. If it will ask you to replace, replace the files. 

  

3. Open the file YESEFTConfig.bat and click Apply and then Ok. 

 

  

 

  

4. Run the file StartPOSServer.bat to initialize the IPC. 

  

 

  

If the above does not resolve the issue then a key / data reset for the PED might be needed from World Pay which can be requested via email.

title: Installing The K3 Wrapper For VeriFone
text: Moving a till to the wrapper is fairly easy process that takes approximately 5 minutes per machine. For the time being, retrieve the latest file from Karl Fletcher. Ensure Sentinel is closed down before starting. If there is a previous version installed, backup the folder: C:\ProgramData\K3 BTG, and grab the PED's IP address from the XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX line from C:\ProgramData\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk.Config. Uninstall the old version in Programs & Features. Install K3 Wrapper, set install location to C:\Programdata\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\ - set full permissions to this folder for everyone. Copy K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk.Config.xml to C:\Programdata\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\ and overwrite the one that is put there by the installer. Edit the MStore(.ini) file in C:\ProgramData\Merac\ with the customers details, if they are not already setup, or add any settings in that are not already in the files you have. Make sure the this is set in the MStore(.ini) file: VERIFONEPATH=C:\Programdata\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\, and the path doesn't have Uks in it. Create C:\Temp\ folder if it is not already there and set full permissions to this folder for everyone. If required, change Till Configuration to VeriFone Integration instead of Sentinel for the till you are editing. Then re-create Till Data and Update till. If the customer wants to change what is required for the PED to accept CNP transactions, insert the VerifoneCNPMatrix.txt within the C:\ProgramData\Merac, and amend to the customers request. Start POS and ensure the PED logs in. The till should be ready to start doing transactions.
description:
Moving a till to the wrapper is fairly easy process that takes approximately 5 minutes per machine. For the time being, retrieve the latest file from Karl Fletcher.

Ensure Sentinel is closed down before starting.
  1. If there is a previous version installed, backup the folder: C:\ProgramData\K3 BTG, and grab the PED's IP address from the <server>XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX</server> line from C:\ProgramData\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk.Config.

  2. Uninstall the old version in Programs & Features.

  3. Install K3 Wrapper, set install location to C:\Programdata\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\ - set full permissions to this folder for everyone.

  4. Copy K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk.Config.xml to C:\Programdata\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\ and overwrite the one that is put there by the installer.

  5. Edit the MStore(.ini) file in C:\ProgramData\Merac\ with the customers details, if they are not already setup, or add any settings in that are not already in the files you have. Make sure the this is set in the MStore(.ini) file: VERIFONEPATH=C:\Programdata\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\, and the path doesn't have Uks in it.
  6. Create C:\Temp\ folder if it is not already there and set full permissions to this folder for everyone.
  7. If required, change Till Configuration to VeriFone Integration instead of Sentinel for the till you are editing. Then re-create Till Data and Update till.
  8. If the customer wants to change what is required for the PED to accept CNP transactions, insert the VerifoneCNPMatrix.txt within the C:\ProgramData\Merac, and amend to the customers request.

  9. Start POS and ensure the PED logs in. The till should be ready to start doing transactions.

title: YesPay config displaying incorrectly
text: This issue is caused by the version of Java installed on the machine as YesEFT is very strict on the Java version used. Please use the link below to download the correct Java MSI to resolve the issue. Ensure you uninstall all current versions of Java on the machine before installing. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AaYME_Udt1rvvsU3Q7fXbWzTkC3w1BS-/view?usp=sharing
description:
This issue is caused by the version of Java installed on the machine as YesEFT is very strict on the Java version used. Please use the link below to download the correct Java MSI to resolve the issue. Ensure you uninstall all current versions of Java on the machine before installing.





https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AaYME_Udt1rvvsU3Q7fXbWzTkC3w1BS-/view?usp=sharing

title: VeriFone Engage Receipt Printing Options
text: By default, the VeriFone Engage software prints both the merchant and cardholder copies of the credit card receipts. If you would like to change this, insert the single relevant line from below into the MStore(.ini) file. WRAPPERRECEIPTS=NONE WRAPPERRECEIPTS=MERCHANTONLY WRAPPERRECEIPTS=CUSTOMERONLY WRAPPERRECEIPTS=BOTH
description:
By default, the VeriFone Engage software prints both the merchant and cardholder copies of the credit card receipts. If you would like to change this, insert the single relevant line from below into the MStore(.ini) file.


WRAPPERRECEIPTS=NONE

WRAPPERRECEIPTS=MERCHANTONLY

WRAPPERRECEIPTS=CUSTOMERONLY

WRAPPERRECEIPTS=BOTH

title: Restarting VeriFone P400 Without Removing Power
text: If you need to restart a VeriFone P400, but are unable to remove the power, perhaps this is inaccessible or you do not know why plug to unplug, then you can hold the red button down for around 6 seconds. A power menu should then appear on the screen where you can then choose to restart the device (need to attempt this myself to see what is displayed on the screen).
description: If you need to restart a VeriFone P400, but are unable to remove the power, perhaps this is inaccessible or you do not know why plug to unplug, then you can hold the red button down for around 6 seconds. A power menu should then appear on the screen where you can then choose to restart the device (need to attempt this myself to see what is displayed on the screen).

title: Information To Get If Customer Reports A Card Payment Issue With The K3 VeriFone Wrapper
text: If a customer reports a payment issue or something crashing when attempting to take a card payment with the K3 VeriFone Wrapper, please retrieve the below information from the customer: Date & Time of this issue occurring. Payment amount. Transaction number, if applicable. Access to the till for the next step. Once you have this information, connect onto the till and retrieve the below files: Relevant TXN file that would have this transaction within from C:\ProgramData\Merac\TXNFiles. VerifoneCCLogFile.txt file in C:\ProgramData\Merac, if present. Relevant log file for the day this issue occurred on from C:\ProgramData\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\logs. Once you have all this information, please pass this over to second line support to get the EFT team involved.
description:
If a customer reports a payment issue or something crashing when attempting to take a card payment with the K3 VeriFone Wrapper, please retrieve the below information from the customer:

  • Date & Time of this issue occurring.
  • Payment amount.
  • Transaction number, if applicable.
  • Access to the till for the next step.


Once you have this information, connect onto the till and retrieve the below files:

  • Relevant TXN file that would have this transaction within from C:\ProgramData\Merac\TXNFiles.
  • VerifoneCCLogFile.txt file in C:\ProgramData\Merac, if present.
  • Relevant log file for the day this issue occurred on from C:\ProgramData\K3 BTG\K3.Eft.Verifone.Uk\logs.


Once you have all this information, please pass this over to second line support to get the EFT team involved.

title: "Bad Input Parameter" When Attempting To Take Card Payment On DNA Payments
text: If you attempt to take a card payment and the POS states "Bad Input Parameters", check the Log file for today in C:\ProgramData\K3 Retail\DnaPaymentsHelperService\1.0.0.9\Logs. This may give you a better idea of the issue, which is likely due to the DnaPaymentsHelperService.exe.config file found in C:\Program Files (x86)\K3 Mstore\DnaPaymentsHelperService. If the log states "Not a valid Terminal ID", then double-check the TID value is correct in the DnaPaymentsHelperService.exe.config file. This is a 10-digit number. 20/05/2025 10:18:18 [DEBUG] Received data: POSTTRANSACTION701_1145710SALE]]> 20/05/2025 10:18:18 [ERROR] PostTransaction, Error from response: Not a valid Terminal ID 20/05/2025 10:18:18 [DEBUG] Sent data: False400Bad Input Parameters
description:
If you attempt to take a card payment and the POS states "Bad Input Parameters", check the Log file for today in C:\ProgramData\K3 Retail\DnaPaymentsHelperService\1.0.0.9\Logs.




This may give you a better idea of the issue, which is likely due to the DnaPaymentsHelperService.exe.config file found in C:\Program Files (x86)\K3 Mstore\DnaPaymentsHelperService.


If the log states "Not a valid Terminal ID", then double-check the TID value is correct in the DnaPaymentsHelperService.exe.config file. This is a 10-digit number.


20/05/2025 10:18:18 [DEBUG] Received data: <?xml version="1.0"?><RequestMethod><value>POSTTRANSACTION</value><data><![CDATA[<amount>70</amount><reference>1_1145710</reference><type>SALE</type>]]></data></RequestMethod>
20/05/2025 10:18:18 [ERROR] PostTransaction, Error from response: Not a valid Terminal ID
20/05/2025 10:18:18 [DEBUG] Sent data: <?xml version="1.0"?><response><success>False</success><statuscode>400</statuscode><message>Bad Input Parameters</message><data></data></response>

title: Customer Not Present (CNP) Transactions Failing with Ocius Sentinel
text: When customers report that Customer Not Present (CNP) transactions are consistently failing or immidiatly voiding on tills using Ocius Sentinel as the payment provider, the issue is typically caused by the presence of the CNPMatrix file. This file enforces automatic AVS-based approval rules which often result in declines. To allow operators to manually authorise CNP transactions, you need to disable this file by renaming it. The CNPMatrix file in C:\ProgramData\Merac\ dictates how the POS handles CNP transactions based on AVS (Address Verification Service) responses. If address or postcode mismatches occur, the logic can automatically block the transaction. Renaming or removing this file disables that logic and defers the decision to the till operator via a Yes/No prompt. Perform the following on each affected till: Open the folder: C:\ProgramData\Merac\ Locate the file: CNPMatrix Rename the file to: CNPMatrix-old If POS is running, restart it to apply the change. This will result in the operator being prompted with a Yes/No dialogue during CNP processing. Selecting Yes will allow the transaction to proceed. This change is safe and reversible. It is a known and supported workaround when AVS checks are too strict for the customer's use case. If you want to keep the matrix file, but still allow CNP transactions, you could set the file to read: H0P0=REJECT H4P4=REJECT H0P4=REJECT H4P0=REJECT H0P1=AUTH H0P2=AUTH H0P8=AUTH H1P0=AUTH H1P1=AUTH H1P2=AUTH H1P4=AUTH H1P8=AUTH H2P0=AUTH H2P1=AUTH H2P2=AUTH H2P4=AUTH H2P8=AUTH H4P1=AUTH H4P2=AUTH H4P8=AUTH H8P0=AUTH H8P1=AUTH H8P2=AUTH H8P4=AUTH H8P8=AUTH You may also want to see: Understanding Verifone Matrix Files
description:
When customers report that Customer Not Present (CNP) transactions are consistently failing or immidiatly voiding on tills using Ocius Sentinel as the payment provider, the issue is typically caused by the presence of the CNPMatrix file. This file enforces automatic AVS-based approval rules which often result in declines.


To allow operators to manually authorise CNP transactions, you need to disable this file by renaming it.


The CNPMatrix file in C:\ProgramData\Merac\ dictates how the POS handles CNP transactions based on AVS (Address Verification Service) responses. If address or postcode mismatches occur, the logic can automatically block the transaction.

Renaming or removing this file disables that logic and defers the decision to the till operator via a Yes/No prompt.


Perform the following on each affected till:

  1. Open the folder: C:\ProgramData\Merac\
  2. Locate the file: CNPMatrix
  3. Rename the file to: CNPMatrix-old


If POS is running, restart it to apply the change.


This will result in the operator being prompted with a Yes/No dialogue during CNP processing. Selecting Yes will allow the transaction to proceed.


This change is safe and reversible. It is a known and supported workaround when AVS checks are too strict for the customer's use case.


If you want to keep the matrix file, but still allow CNP transactions, you could set the file to read:


H0P0=REJECT

H4P4=REJECT

H0P4=REJECT

H4P0=REJECT

H0P1=AUTH

H0P2=AUTH

H0P8=AUTH

H1P0=AUTH

H1P1=AUTH

H1P2=AUTH

H1P4=AUTH

H1P8=AUTH

H2P0=AUTH

H2P1=AUTH

H2P2=AUTH

H2P4=AUTH

H2P8=AUTH

H4P1=AUTH

H4P2=AUTH

H4P8=AUTH

H8P0=AUTH

H8P1=AUTH

H8P2=AUTH

H8P4=AUTH

H8P8=AUTH



You may also want to see: Understanding Verifone Matrix Files

title: Understanding Verifone CNP Matrix Files
text: Intro This guide explains the purpose, structure, and usage of Verifone matrix files (e.g., VerifoneCNPMatrix) used in MStore POS integrations with Ocius Sentinel. These files define how transactions are handled and authorised, specifically in relation to CNP (Customer Not Present) AVS (Address Verification Service) responses. What Are Verifone Matrix Files? Verifone matrix files are plain-text configuration files located on each till, typically in: C:\ProgramData\Merac\VerifoneCNPMatrix This file determines whether a CNP card transaction should be automatically authorised or rejected based on the results of AVS checks (address and postcode matching). Why They Matter Without proper configuration, these files can cause legitimate CNP transactions to be declined, often with no visible error other than a failed payment. By adjusting the matrix, we can: Allow or block specific AVS result combinations. Control fraud risk tolerance. Enable till operators to manually approve transactions. How the Matrix Works Each line in the matrix follows this format: H#P#=AUTH or REJECT H# = Result of House Number check P# = Result of Postcode check AVS Result Codes: CodeMeaning 0 Unknown 1 Not Checked 2 Matched 4 Not Matched 8 Partial Match Values: AUTH, OK, YES, TRUE, 1 → Authorise transaction REJECT, NO, FALSE, 0, blank → Reject transaction e.g. H2P2=AUTH This line authorises a CNP transaction where both house number and postcode matched. Default Behaviour If a combination is not listed in the matrix file: It is treated as authorised by default. The exception is H2P2, which is always considered safe and allowed (if CSC matches). Best Practices for Support Keep changes consistent across all tills. Only reject clearly invalid combinations, such as both house number and postcode not matching or unknown. If unsure, fall back to renaming the matrix file, which forces the system to prompt the operator instead of making automatic decisions.
description:
Intro

This guide explains the purpose, structure, and usage of Verifone matrix files (e.g., VerifoneCNPMatrix) used in MStore POS integrations with Ocius Sentinel. These files define how transactions are handled and authorised, specifically in relation to CNP (Customer Not Present) AVS (Address Verification Service) responses.


What Are Verifone Matrix Files?

Verifone matrix files are plain-text configuration files located on each till, typically in: C:\ProgramData\Merac\VerifoneCNPMatrix


This file determines whether a CNP card transaction should be automatically authorised or rejected based on the results of AVS checks (address and postcode matching).


Why They Matter

Without proper configuration, these files can cause legitimate CNP transactions to be declined, often with no visible error other than a failed payment. By adjusting the matrix, we can:

  • Allow or block specific AVS result combinations.

  • Control fraud risk tolerance.

  • Enable till operators to manually approve transactions.



How the Matrix Works

Each line in the matrix follows this format: H#P#=AUTH or REJECT

  • H# = Result of House Number check

  • P# = Result of Postcode check


AVS Result Codes:

CodeMeaning
0Unknown
1Not Checked
2Matched
4Not Matched
8Partial Match


Values:

  • AUTH, OK, YES, TRUE, 1 → Authorise transaction
  • REJECT, NO, FALSE, 0, blank → Reject transaction


e.g.  H2P2=AUTH

This line authorises a CNP transaction where both house number and postcode matched.


Default Behaviour

If a combination is not listed in the matrix file:

  • It is treated as authorised by default.

  • The exception is H2P2, which is always considered safe and allowed (if CSC matches).


Best Practices for Support

  • Keep changes consistent across all tills.

  • Only reject clearly invalid combinations, such as both house number and postcode not matching or unknown.

  • If unsure, fall back to renaming the matrix file, which forces the system to prompt the operator instead of making automatic decisions.
